content:
I'm imagining that this stream is public for anyone interested in the planning process for Backdrop CMS Live. We've named it such that we can use it for other future event planning.

It seems justified to open a new Stream for this, because it could get pretty heavy usage for the next few weeks with what is essentially administrative tasks for this event (which only apply to a few people).
Let's not forget to remind folks that this stream is available for those who are interested.
I added a few people that I know 100% want to be here. I'll let others find their own way.
I'm surprised you wouldn't think I would 100% want to be here.

oadaeh (Jason Flatt) said:

I'm surprised you wouldn't think I would 100% want to be here.

I just knew that you would find your own way here quickly!
I was only 98.7% sure with you.
This stream currently has only 5 people, but I will continue to remind folks to look here for the minutia of event planning - and I will post big updates to the main Stream.

@StPaulTim I have an idea for a session/talk I could maybe do, but I'd like to confirm with my family a time first so I know if it's possible for me to commit to that. Can you share the spreadsheet with the timeslots please?

@BWPanda - We don't have any kind of official schedule yet. The spreadsheet that I shared was a draft. We might be able to have something reliable this week and I can share it then. Hopefully, you noticed that we are planning to schedule 3 hour blocks of sessions over a 24 hour time frame, so that there will be opportunities for everyone to participate, regardless of their timezone.

Again, we may be able to provide you with a rough schedule by end of week.

Can I still see it anyway, knowing that it might change? I just want a rough idea of when things might be happening, rather than trying to figure it out with timezones, etc. (since it looks like you already did that)...
Sure, I'll give the spreadsheet I'm working with now. Just remember, it's very ROUGH and times may change.

@BWPanda - Here is a link to the spreadsheet:
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/15MUJf9RMqi2Bk-cY3KhO0nypCsmwI4K3cJcM7h4GS7Y/edit#gid=1781014754

Final reminder that this was only my sandbox schedule, nothing has been officially decided, other than a general agreement to work with something like this. Part of our current thinking is that we'll wait for a final schedule until we get a better idea of who is registering and where they are from.
However, I think that if it's helpful to you, we might be able to schedule a time block for you sooner rather than later.
I think we'll discuss this at meeting on Thursday/Friday.
Cool, thanks.

If I end up doing what I'm thinking about (if it's approved, my family's ok with the timing, etc.) then I think my session might be a good one for the first block or so, as it's an introduction to GitHub (since a lot of Drupal 7 people might not know GitHub). Stuff like, creating an account, the code repo, issue queue, pull requests, etc.

I think that's a great idea! I'm really hoping that we have a mix of Backdrop specific topics along with topics that are less specific to Backdrop (general opensource CMS stuff).

I imagine that you might use the Backdrop project for some examples, but the skills would all apply to any project?

Well it'd be aimed at helping people get involved in Backdrop contribution (be it finding issues, filing issues, PRs, etc.). So I'd show the various Backdrop repos, etc., but yes, skills translatable to other projects too.
@StPaulTim Based on the current, rough, likely-to-change schedule/timeslots, Friday 2-3pm Syd time would suit me best.
Welcome @Steve Moorhouse
Ideally, we're doing most of the detailed planning here with occasional updates to the main Backdrop CMS stream.
I will be working on Backdrop Live issues tomorrow afternoon. If anyone is around and wants to help.
@jenlampton - If you are around this afternoon, ping me.
